intro: Euonymus zogangensis, commonly known as the Zogang euonymus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Celastraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, particularly in Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in the spring. Following flowering, it produces distinctive red-orange berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
